title: Trump's $2,000 dividend for Americans, are you eligible? Check structure, date & more
content: Donald Trump announced a $2,000 per person dividend funded by tariff revenues, excluding high-income individuals. While details on eligibility, structure, and timing remain unclear, the proposal could be implemented through tax changes like deductions and tax-free tips. This initiative, requiring congressional approval, faces scrutiny regarding the legality of tariffs.

title: Video of namaz at Bengaluru airport goes viral; BJP targets Karnataka govt
content: A video of Muslims praying at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport Terminal 2 has ignited a political storm. The BJP is demanding answers from the state government, questioning permission for prayers in a high-security zone and contrasting it with restrictions on RSS activities. The government has yet to comment on the security implications.

title: Sam Altman says, ‚ÄòSlack creates a lot of fake work‚Äô; Elon Musk responds
content: Elon Musk believes OpenAI, led by Sam Altman, will directly challenge Microsoft after Altman criticized current office tools like Slack for creating "fake work." Altman envisions AI agents handling communication, while Musk's comment suggests OpenAI's new ventures, including selling AI cloud compute, will put it in competition with tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.

title: 'Go and attack!' - Akash Choudhary reveals mindset behind eight sixes in a row
content: Meghalaya's Akash Kumar Choudhary shattered Ranji Trophy records with the fastest first-class fifty in just 11 balls, including eight consecutive sixes. Batting at number eight, his aggressive knock of 50 off 14 balls helped Meghalaya declare at 628/6. Chaudhary credited his coach for the fearless approach and expressed pride in India's Women's World Cup win.

title: $2.5K, clothes, & books: Musk recalls moving to Canada; shares 3 things he had
content: Elon Musk revealed he arrived in Montreal at 17 with only $2500, a bag of clothes, and books. This statement followed criticism from author Joyce Carol Oates regarding his perceived lack of cultural engagement. Musk also defended his Tesla compensation, linking it to the company's growth and shareholder votes.

title: Indians abducted in Mali: Embassy vows safe release; calls it an 'unfortunate incident'
content: Five Indian nationals were kidnapped in Mali. The Indian Embassy is actively collaborating with Malian authorities to ensure their swift and safe return. The men were working on an electrification project when gunmen intercepted their convoy. Remaining employees have been safely evacuated. Mali faces ongoing threats from jihadist groups, leading to travel advisories from several nations.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the rate outlook for this week? Things to watch out
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are set to react to global economic shifts this week. The US dollar's strength and reduced expectations for Fed rate cuts are currently impacting gold. Upcoming US government funding news and trade talks between the US and China will be key drivers.

title: Bill Gates on foundation‚Äôs role; not replacing US aid: ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs not our job‚Äô
content: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: Party behind bars: After phone and TV clips, new Bengaluru Jail video shows prisoners drinking, dancing
content: Bengaluru Central Prison faces renewed controversy as a video emerges showing inmates partying with liquor and makeshift instruments. This follows earlier footage of high-profile prisoners using phones and watching TV. Home Minister G Parameshwara vows stringent action against officials and promises improved surveillance, including CCTVs and jammers, to curb these repeated security breaches.

title: 'From suspension to swap?' - Why Jadeja made a shock exit from Rajasthan Royals in 2010
content: IPL 2025 trade talks are heating up as Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals discuss a potential Ravindra Jadeja-Sanju Samson swap. This comes after RR's previous attempt to acquire Jadeja, who was controversially released by them in 2010 for contract violations, potentially leading to a full-circle return.

title: Hyderabad realtor kills wife with cricket bat over suspicion of infidelity
content: A real estate businessman allegedly bludgeoned his wife to death with a cricket bat in Ameenpur, suspecting her of infidelity. The victim, an assistant bank manager, died at the scene after a heated argument. Their son alerted grandparents and neighbours, leading to the husband's arrest and the weapon's seizure by police.

title: Nepal trek tragedy: Missing Surat father-daughter duo found buried under snow
content: The bodies of Surat-based teacher Jignesh Patel and his daughter Priyanshi were discovered buried in snow in Nepal's Manang district. The duo, who went missing during a trekking expedition near the Annapurna-3 peak, were last heard from on October 21. Authorities launched extensive aerial and ground searches after their family raised an alarm.

title: Watch: Indian man in US goes viral for helping paralysed woman stranded in heavy rain
content: An Indian man in the United States stopped to help a paralyzed woman stranded in heavy rain. He offered her a ride to her daughter's house. The man shared the video on Instagram, recounting the moving encounter. The clip captured widespread attention and touched viewers with its display of humanity.

title: From 'fun start' to 'fun end': Pakistan captain's brutal reply to India skipper
content: In the final, Pakistan were at their ruthless best. Batting first, they piled up 135/3 with explosive hitting across the order. Kuwait, who had stunned several big teams including Afghanistan, India, and England to reach the final, began their chase in blazing fashion ‚Äî hammering 32 runs off the opening over. But Pakistan‚Äôs bowlers regrouped swiftly. Shahzad, Maaz Sadaqat, and Abbas Afridi bowled tight lines, triggering a dramatic collapse. Kuwait went from dream start to total despair, eventually folding well short of the target.

title: 23-yr-old Andhra Pradesh student found dead in US
content: A 23-year-old Andhra Pradesh student, Rajyalakshmi Yarlagadda, tragically passed away in her sleep in the US on November 7. A recent graduate, she harbored dreams of supporting her farming family back home. Her sudden demise has left her loved ones heartbroken and facing financial strain, prompting a GoFundMe to cover funeral costs and aid her parents.

title: Lenskart listing today: After stellar IPO, shares list at 3% discount; check details
content: Lenskart Solutions made its stock market debut today on NSE and BSE, following a highly subscribed IPO. Despite strong investor interest, pre-listing sentiment saw the grey market premium shrink. Analysts offer mixed views, with some citing valuation concerns while others praise its resilient business model and growth potential in the expanding eyewear market.

title: Michael Willis Heard cause of death: How did the TikTok star Yes King die
content: TikTok sensation Michael Willis Heard, known as 'Yes King,' has passed away. His daughter confirmed the news, remembering him for his uplifting videos promoting self-love and confidence. The Elyria, Ohio native, who also served as a life coach and pastor-like figure, inspired millions with his positive energy. His sudden departure has deeply saddened his global fanbase.

title: 'Grateful to be living in Goa: Delhi air 'hard to digest' for South African cricket legend Jonty Rhodes
content: South African cricket legend Jonty Rhodes voiced concern over Delhi's severe air quality, contrasting it with his clean Goan home. The capital endured a thick smog, with AQI readings in the 'very poor' category, nearing 'severe'. Delhi's environment minister highlighted government efforts while criticizing the previous administration's decade of inaction on pollution.

title: Sexual harassment in women's cricket: 'Zero tolerance' - BCB chief vows strict action
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board launches a probe into sexual harassment allegations by cricketer Jahanara Alam against a former selector Manjurul Alam.  The BCB president Aminul Islam vows zero tolerance, assuring no one is above the law. A three-member committee will investigate, with four officials placed on special duty pending the inquiry's findings.

title: Ecuador prison clash: Violence over transfer to 'maximum-security' prison; 31 killed
content: At least 31 inmates perished in a brutal clash at Ecuador's Machala Prison, with authorities citing asphyxiation as the cause for many. The violence, marked by gunfire and screams, is the latest in a series of deadly prison riots fueled by overcrowding and gang rivalries. This incident highlights the escalating crisis within Ecuador's penal system.

title: Can India find a place for Dhruv Jurel in South Africa series?
content: Dhruv Jurel scored his maiden Test century against West Indies last month in the absence of an injured Pant before hitting back-to-back unbeaten and commanding tons in the second unofficial Test against South Africa ‚ÄòA‚Äô in Bengaluru in the past seven days. Sudharsan‚Äôs indifferent returns at No. 3 since his debut at Leeds in June will test the team management‚Äôs resolve.

title: Ecuador, not Everest, is the closest place on Earth to outer space; here‚Äôs the reason
content: Ecuador's Mount Chimborazo is scientifically closer to space than Mount Everest, not due to sea-level height, but Earth's equatorial bulge. This bulge makes points near the equator farther from the planet's center. Chimborazo's summit extends 2.1 kilometers further from Earth's core than Everest's, making it the most distant surface point from the planet's center and thus closest to outer space.

title: Mystery deepens around Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife Brittani after shocking update before Steelers‚Äô Sunday Night Football
content: Aaron Rodgers' marriage to Brittani has become a major talking point, with no one, not even his teammates or family, having met her. Rodgers stated his wife is private and chooses not to be in the public eye, leaving her identity and presence a mystery despite his openness about being married.

title: US shutdown crisis averted? Senators strike bipartisan deal ‚Äì all you need to know
content: US senators reached an agreement to end the 40-day government shutdown, with a future vote on extending Affordable Care Act subsidies as part of the deal. President Trump indicated the shutdown would end soon, while Senate Republicans confirmed a spending package was coming together. The agreement includes full-year funding for some departments and extends funding for others through January.

title: Tom Brady reacts after Fox Sports replaces Mark Sanchez with Drew Brees
content: Tom Brady reacts to Drew Brees replacing Mark Sanchez at FOX Sports as the network cuts ties with Sanchez amid his felony case. Brady‚Äôs accuracy comment, Brees‚Äô career stats and statements, and FOX‚Äôs broadcast shakeup headline a major shift. Full details on Brees‚Äô new role, Sanchez‚Äôs exit and what Brady‚Äôs reaction means for FOX Sports.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: ‚ÄòHelp us breathe‚Äô: Delhi AQI slips to ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô; protesters rally at India Gate, many detained
content: Dozens were detained at India Gate during a clean air protest, with participants demanding urgent government action against Delhi's "air emergency." Protesters, including parents and children, highlighted the health crisis with poignant placards and symbolic props. Police stated only those blocking traffic were detained and later released.

title: IND vs AUS: 'He plays second fiddle'- Ex-India cricketer's shocking claim on Gill‚Äôs T20I form
content: Shubman Gill is now playing a supporting role to Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting in T20 internationals. Former India pacer Varun Aaron notes Gill's adjustment to this new dynamic. Sharma's ability to perform across different conditions and his proactive approach are highlighted. This opening pair offers a promising start for India's T20 strategy.

title: 'Please don't send me to school': In Jaipur suicide case, audio of girl‚Äôs plea to mother surfaces
content: A nine-year-old girl's desperate plea to her mother, recorded a year ago, has surfaced after her death from a fall at Neerja Modi School. The audio reveals her fear of returning to school due to alleged ongoing bullying.

title: Joe Alwyn‚Äôs clover photo sparks Swiftie claims of quiet nod to Taylor Swift
content: Swifties believe Joe Alwyn‚Äôs Instagram photo featuring a heart-shaped dish with a four-leaf clover was a subtle show of support for Taylor Swift‚Äôs $360 million masters buyback deal. Fans linked the clover to Shamrock Capital, interpreting the image as a quiet nod to Swift‚Äôs victory, even though Alwyn never addressed it publicly.

title: Doctor reveals Ranbir‚Äôs improved transplant, Salman‚Äôs surgeries & SRK‚Äôs natural hair
content: Celebrity dermatologist and hair transplant expert Dr Gaurang Krishna recently opened up about Bollywood actors who have undergone hair transplants. The renowned doctor shared insights into why hair transplants are often performed in multiple sessions and discussed results seen on popular stars like Salman Khan and Ranbir Kapoor, while also revealing which actor he believes has the best natural hair in the industry.

title: 'Ye mar jayega, ro dega': Yuvraj‚Äôs hilarious revelation about Abhishek Sharma - Watch
content: Yuvraj Singh humorously revealed Abhishek Sharma's fierce protectiveness over his cricket bats, stating the young batter would fight or cry before parting with one. This anecdote comes as Abhishek achieves a world record for the fastest 1,000 T20I runs and shines as India's top-ranked T20I batter.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,550; BSE Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 25,550, BSE Sensex was up over 200 points.

title: Bengaluru double murder: How Rs 5 crore losses led bizman to kill his friends for money
content: A former grocery chain owner, Ravi Prasad Reddy, arrested for murdering two friends, turned to vegetable vending after a Rs 5 crore loss during the Covid-19 pandemic. Driven by financial desperation and hatred, Reddy allegedly murdered his friends to rob them, inspired by crime films.

title: Rohingya boat capsizes: 7 dead, hundreds missing near Thai-Malaysia border
content: A boat carrying Rohingya refugees has sunk near the Thailand-Malaysia border. At least seven people have died and 13 have been rescued. Hundreds are feared missing. The refugees were attempting to reach Malaysia to escape persecution in Myanmar. This incident highlights the ongoing dangers faced by the Rohingya community.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for this week - Check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified L&T Finance and Rubicon Research as top stock picks for the week of November 10, 2025. L&T Finance is transforming into a digital-first retail financier, while Rubicon Research is strengthening its position as a research-led pharmaceutical company focused on regulated markets.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir told to 'sacrifice' one player
content: Dhruv Jurel‚Äôs recent form bolsters his case further ‚Äî he scored 125 against the West Indies in the first Test in October and followed it up with an unbeaten 132 for India A against South Africa A.

title: BBC director-general Tim Davie quits after 20 years amid row over editing Trump speech
content: BBC director-general Tim Davie and News CEO Deborah Turness have resigned following a major controversy over a Panorama documentary. The program allegedly misedited Donald Trump's speech, making it seem he intended to march on the US Capitol. An internal dossier revealed editorial failures, sparking widespread anger and prompting calls for accountability.

title: 'Dynasty' star Betty Harford, passes away at 98
content: Veteran star Betty Harford, celebrated for her roles in 'The Paper Chase,' 'Dynasty,' and more, has passed away at 98. Confirmed by her friend Wendy Mitchell, Harford's career spanned radio, television, and film, beginning in the 1950s. Her notable works include 'Spartacus,' 'Inside Daisy Clover,' and a memorable turn as Mrs. Nottingham in 'The Paper Chase.'

title: Legendary NBA player, coach Wilkens dies at 88
content: Lenny Wilkens, a smooth playmaker who was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame as both a player and a coach, has died. He was 88.

title: Guardians' Clase, Ortiz indicted for pitch rigging
content: Cleveland Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz have been indicted on a host of charges related to an alleged scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown in MLB games. Ortiz is in custody.

title: Allen draws up play to set Chargers' catch mark
content: Chargers wide receiver Keenan Allen became the franchise's all-time leader in receptions with 956 catches, passing Hall of Fame tight end Antonio Gates.

title: Campbell takes over playcalling; Lions score 44
content: Lions coach Dan Campbell took over playcalling duties from first-year offensive coordinator John Morton this past week, and it ignited a dominant 44-22 victory over the Washington Commanders on Sunday.

title: Rodgers offers blunt self-assessment after SNF dud
content: "This was not my best performance," QB Aaron Rodgers said following the worst game of his Steelers career, which came in a 25-10 loss to the Chargers on "Sunday Night Football."

title: Lawrence wows with near-identical defensive TDs
content: DeMarcus Lawrence became the fourth player in NFL history with multiple fumble return touchdowns in the same game, doing so on near-identical plays Sunday against the Cardinals.

title: Rams WRs: Stafford belongs in MVP conversation
content: Rams receiver Davante Adams said he thinks quarterback Matthew Stafford's play has "looked like MVP play to me all year, to be honest."

title: Giants' Dart suffers concussion in loss to Bears

content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: Congress says NDA ‚Äòconceding defeat‚Äô in Bihar Assembly polls
content: Addressing presspersons in Patna, Congress leader Pawan Khera claimed that following the high voter turnout in the first phase and growing public support for the Opposition INDIA bloc ahead of the final phase on November 11, NDA leaders have begun vacating their official residences

title: Bihar Assembly election: Second phase campaign ends, polling in 122 seats on November 11
content: Amit Shah says there is no vacancy for CM post; Rahul Gandhi takes a dig at PM over ‚Äòvote theft‚Äô; Tejashwi asks voters for a chance to fulfil his poll promises

title: Along with the BJP, descendants of Bankim Chandra highlight neglect to writer‚Äôs house in Kolkata
content: State BJP president Samik Bhattacharya and two descendants of the writer said that the house of Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay on 5, Pratap Chatterjee Street in Kolkata, which was taken over by the West Bengal government, lies in a state of neglect

title: KSRTC‚Äôs initiative for visually challenged passengers wins national award
content: KSRTC‚Äôs Dhwani Spandana project, a first-of-its-kind initiative for visually impaired passengers received the honour for its work in creating an inclusive and accessible public transport system.

title: Stalin says SIR enumeration form is full of confusion, warns of likely deletion of voters‚Äô names
content: The Chief Minister and DMK president says that it is not clear whether the details sought of the relatives refer to parents, brothers, sisters, husband or wife

title: Minor girl gang-raped after being dragged to school premises in Madhya Pradesh; three held
content: The two accused men have been sent to judicial custody by a court while the minor accused has been sent to a juvenile home.

title: T.N. unit of Congress joins DMK in SC against SIR, terms it ‚Äòde novo citizenship verification process‚Äô
content: Both petitions have argued that the SIR exercise compromised the principles of universal adult franchise and free and fair elections

title: Political surprises in the offing in upcoming civic polls to Kochi Corpn.
content: A few prominent leaders are likely to contest as candidates from rival political camps; the political fronts are expected to announce their lists in a couple of days

title: Uneven stretches along metro corridor in Kochi remain a safety concern
content: Stretches of key roads, including Sahodaran Ayyappan Road, M.G. Road, and Banerjee Road, are uneven, with their surfaces near the metro pile caps sinking

title: Malappuram poised to notch hat-trick in State school science fest
content: Having scored 891 points, the district enjoys a hefty lead over the other competitors with just one day of the event remaining

title: NDA‚Äôs seat count in Bihar will fall below 100: CPI(ML) Liberation leader
content: The Left leader expressed shock over Prime Minister Narendra Modi's use of words like katta (country-made firearm) during the election campaign

title: Four-year-old girl abducted from railway shed, sexually assaulted in Bengal‚Äôs Tarakeshwar; one detained
content: The girl was abducted on Saturday (November 8, 2025) when she was asleep beside her grandmother at the railway shed, officials said

title: Kanaka Durga temple removes encroachments, opens¬†Arjitha Seva centre
content: A temporary prasadam counter and cloakroom have been set up at the site, operating during temple hours, says temple executive officer

title: Nutritious Ippa laddu now available throughout the year
content: The Bheem Bhai Tribal Women‚Äôs Cooperative Society, is planning to increase its production and is also looking for a franchise model to sell the products, explained a person associated with the cooperative

title: LSGD identifies new sites for regional sanitary waste incineration facilities in Kerala
content: The proposed plants, each capable of processing 20 tonnes of waste per day, will be established in Kottarakara in Kollam, Muvattupuzha in Ernakulam, Kuttippuram in Malappuram and Kadannappalli in Kannur.

title: PM Modi lauds Bhutanese leadership for welcome accorded to Buddha's relics from India
content: A portion of the holy relics of Lord Buddha from India was enshrined at Thimpu's prominent monastery, Tashichhodzong, considered the seat of Bhutan's highest spiritual and political institutions

title: CBI‚Äôs SIT finds TTD received adulterated ghee for over five years
content: Probe reveals Bhole Baba Dairy supplied ‚Çπ250-crore worth of spurious ghee without procuring milk; chemicals used to manipulate quality tests, supplies continued even after blacklisting

title: Home Minister hints at forming committee to recommend security measures in Parappana Agrahara Central Prison
content: Government would take strict action against officials who have erred and take measures to ensure this doesn‚Äôt recur, says Chief Minister Siddaramaiah

title: Cyclone Montha floods Veligonda project, restoration work under way
content: Over 36 million cubic feet of water enters tunnels after canal breach; de-watering expected to finish by mid-November

title: Congress defends new flyover projects in Mysuru, hits out at BJP
content: KPCC spokesperson M. Lakshman accuses the BJP of being ‚Äòanti-development‚Äô;¬†says Mysuru MP‚Äôs opposition to the projects is ‚Äòpurely political‚Äô

title: Registration not mandatory, we are recognised as a body of individuals: RSS chief
content: When asked whether Muslims and Christians are allowed to join the RSS, Mohan Bhagwat said they were welcome but with one condition: that they should identify themselves as the children of Bharat Mata

title: Special Intensive Revision: Kerala likely to complete  distribution of enumeration forms by November 25
content: By Nov. 9 evening, BLOs had distributed a little over 64.45 lakh enumeration forms in the State, according to the Chief Electoral Officer‚Äôs office. This number constitutes 23.14% of the total forms to be distributed.

title: Watch: Bihar: Lalu, Nitish & Tejashwi | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we take a deep dive into the political dynamics of Bihar ‚Äî examining the evolving relationships and power plays between Lalu Prasad Yadav, Nitish Kumar and Tejashwi Yadav

title: Koramangala shows the way: Footpaths earn a ‚Äòthumbs up‚Äô in walkability test in Bengaluru
content: The walk was part of the Project Walkaluru, a citizen initiative aimed at identifying and celebrating the city‚Äôs best pedestrian infrastructure

title: Family of deceased woman alleges medical negligence
content: Shivapriya had delivered a boy at the SAT hospital on October 22. She died on November 9 following post-partum sepsis

title: Woman, 23, Dies Of Electrocution While Using Water Heater Rod In Delhi
content: A 23-year-old woman from Manipur died of electrocution while heating water with an electric rod at her house in southwest Delhi's Mahipalpur, police said on Monday.

title: Ganja Worth Rs 1 Crore, Some Exotic Animals Seized At Bengaluru Airport
content: Customs officials have arrested two passengers who arrived from Bangkok at the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) here and seized exotic wildlife species from them, officials said on Monday.

title: Voting For Telangana's Jubilee Hills Bypoll To Be Held Tomorrow
content: Polling for the high-stakes bypoll to Jubilee Hills Assembly constituency in Telangana would be held on November 11.

title: Lenskart Shares Make Weak Debut On Bourses, Listed With 3% Discount
content: Shares of eyewear retailer Lenskart Solutions made a weak market debut on Monday, listing with a discount of 3 per cent against the issue price of Rs 402.

title: Mysuru Class 8 Student Undergoes Surgery After Bullies Kick Him In Testicles
content: In a shocking case of bullying in Karnataka's Mysuru, a 13-year-old boy has suffered a serious injury to his testicles after three of his classmates assaulted him on the school premises

title: Ammonium Nitrate, 20 Timers, Rifle, Pistol: What Cops Found In Faridabad After J&K Doctors' Arrest
content: A large amount of alarming explosives have been recovered from Haryana's Faridabad, days after two Jammu and Kashmir doctors were arrested over suspected links with the terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed.

title: 350 kg Explosives, Rifle Found Near Delhi, 2 J&K Doctors Arrested In 15 Days
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police recover 350 kg of ammonium nitrate, an AK-47 rifle, and ammunition from Faridabad near Delhi

title: Trump To Host Syria's Ahmed al-Sharaa At The White House Today
content: President Donald Trump is hosting Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa at the White House on Monday, welcoming the once-pariah state into a US-led global coalition to fight the Islamic State group.

title: Ande Sri, Poet Who Gave Telangana Its Iconic State Anthem, Dies At 64
content: Renowned poet and lyricist Ande Sri, author of the iconic Telangana State song "Jaya Jayahe Telangana," died in Hyderabad. His sudden demise, at 64, has been described as an irreparable loss to the literary and cultural world of Telangana.

title: Video: Moment When Russian Chopper Broke Into 2 Parts Before Crash Killing 4
content: At least five people, including four senior executives of a Russian military factory, have been killed in a helicopter crash in the Republic of Dagestan.

title: Who Is Adil Ahmad Rather, J&K Doctor Arrested Over Suspected Terror Links
content: A team of Jammu and Kashmir police found 350 kg of ammonium nitrate, assault rifles, and ammunition from Haryana's Faridabad.

title: 1.35 Lakh Crore Litre Capacity Water Tank Bursts In Kochi, Houses Flooded
content: The incident occurred around 2 am, catching several families in their sleep. No causalities have been reported, the officials said.

title: The 2013 Breakup: When Nitish Kumar Walked Away From BJP, Narendra Modi
content: Post split from the BJP, Nitish Kumar joined forces with the RJD and Congress to form the Mahagathbandhan (Grand Alliance).¬†

title: Satya Nadella Flags Power Supply As AI Industry's Biggest Bottleneck
content: In the race for AI dominance, American tech giants have the money and the chips, but their ambitions have hit a new obstacle: electric power.

title: Kash Patel Secretly Visited China To Discuss Fentanyl After Trump-Xi Summit: Report
content: FBI Director Kash Patel visited China last week to discuss fentanyl and law enforcement issues, two people familiar with his trip told Reuters, following a summit between the US and Chinese presidents where both hailed "consensus" on the matter.

title: US Senate Takes First Step Toward Ending Government Shutdown After 40 Days
content: The Senate took the first step to end the government shutdown on Sunday after a group of moderate Democrats agreed to proceed without a guaranteed extension of health care subsidies, angering many in their caucus.

title: "I Swear On Quran I Didn't Seek Alliance With BJP": Omar Abdullah
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Sunday refuted allegations made by the BJP that he sought an alliance with the ruling party at the Centre in 2024 for the restoration of statehood.

title: Israel Receives Remains Of Soldier Hadar Goldin Killed In 2014 Gaza War
content: Israel on Sunday confirmed it had received the remains of Hadar Goldin, a soldier killed in the Gaza Strip in 2014, closing a painful chapter for the country.

title: 21-Year-Old Kills 3 Co-Workers In Texas, Then Shoots Self
content: A 21-year-old man shot and killed three co-workers at a San Antonio, Texas, landscape supply company and then died after shooting himself, authorities said Sunday.

title: China's "Goddess Of Wealth" Faces Jail In UK Over $6 Billion Bitcoin Scam
content: She lived a life of luxury that earned her the nickname "goddess of wealth", but Chinese businesswoman Zhimin Qian now faces a long jail sentence after police made the UK's largest-ever cryptocurrency seizure of Bitcoin worth over $6 billion.

title: üèÄ The Bilas Index: The top 68 teams this season
content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .
